page.title: 01Block 04160435,Bradford
page.content: Much of the area is bounded by 3 valleys:-Bradford Beck,Fagley Beck and the R.Aire.Most of the area overlooks these valleys to the west,to the east and to the north.The highest part of the block is on Idle Hill at 228m while the lowest point is 55m in the Aire Valley at Apperley Bridge.The small area of the block,to the east of Fagley Beck,is in Leeds MDC whilst the NW corner of the block is in Shipley,now part of Bradford MDC. The A658,Bradford-Harrogate road,crosses the Aire Valley at Apperley Bridge.The A657,Leeds-Shipley road,uses the higher slopes of the Aire Valley and meets the A658 at Greengates.There are no railways in the block.The Leeds-Liverpool Canal,mainly used for pleasure craft,uses the Aire Valley in the NE corner of the block.
